document_title: Chronic ischemic heart disease: Causes and treatments
subsection_content:
BS.CK II Vo Ngoc Cam, Deputy Department of Cardiovascular Resuscitation, Cardiovascular Center, Tam Anh General Hospital, Ho Chi Minh City, said that at the Cardiovascular Center of Tam Anh General Hospital System, Ho Chi Minh City, the diagnosis Diagnosing chronic ischemic heart disease is a strict process including the following steps: (3)
Clinical diagnosis
The doctor explores the patient's symptoms, inquires about the patient's and his family's medical history, and conducts initial examinations including measuring blood pressure, listening to the heart, etc.
Paraclinical diagnosis
When a patient has symptoms that are suspicious or suggestive of chronic ischemic heart disease, the doctor will prescribe the patient to perform a number of paraclinical diagnoses including:
Biochemical blood test: check the number of red blood cells and platelets in the blood, evaluate cholesterol levels, blood sugar, kidney function, liver function, electrolytes,...; Electrocardiogram diagnoses myocardial ischemia: can see ST-T wave changes, left ventricular thickening, old myocardial infarction scars,...; Doppler echocardiography: identifies regional movement disorders suspected to be caused by coronary artery disease, evaluates heart function, heart valve disease,...; Stress test: helps determine myocardial ischemia, stratifies risk (low, medium and high) for further treatment.; Holter electrocardiogram: attaches a heart rate monitoring device to the patient for 24-48 hours to detect the occurrence of ischemic heart disease and many other arrhythmias.; Coronary CT angiography: records images of narrowed or blocked coronary arteries, location and extent of narrowing to guide treatment.; Coronary angiography: is the gold standard in diagnosing the disease, often prescribed by doctors to patients with coronary insufficiency to determine whether intervention is needed or not.
Tam Anh General Hospital owns a modern equipment system to help with early detection and effective treatment
